ECMFA is a forum dedicated to advancing knowledge and fostering the application of Model-Based Engineering (MBE) and related approaches.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ECMFA 2025

The 21st European Conference on Modelling Foundations and Applications (ECMFA) is soliciting papers presenting original research on all aspects of model-based engineering (MBE).

## Aims and Scope

ECMFA is the premier European forum dedicated to advancing the state of knowledge and fostering the application of all aspects of MBE and related approaches. It aims to engage key figures in research and industry to enhance the practical application of MBE, leading to more reliable software based on state-of-the-art research results.

## Submission Types

Two types of submissions are invited:

*   **Foundation Papers:** These papers should deal with modeling foundations, such as metamodeling, model transformations, model validation, verification and testing, model engineering methods and tools, and related aspects.
*   **Application Papers:** These papers should focus on the application of modeling techniques, including experience reports on the use of MBE methods and tools, industrial case studies, or successful applications of MBE practices in industry or public administration, with significant modeling lessons learned. All applications must have been done in real contexts, and at least one author must be affiliated with the company or administration where the application took place.

## Submission Process

*   Submissions must conform to the JOT LaTeX template ([https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip](https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip)).
*   Papers must not exceed **14 pages** (including figures, references, and appendices). Secondary studies may use 2 additional pages for references only.
*   Failure to conform to these guidelines may result in disqualification.
*   Simultaneous submission to other publication outlets is not allowed and will result in immediate rejection.
*   All submissions will be peer-reviewed by at least three members of the Program Committee.
*   Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format through Easychair (link to be published).

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Foundations of MBE, including model transformations, domain-specific languages, verification and validation approaches, etc.
*   Novel paradigms, formalisms, applications, approaches, frameworks, or processes for model-based engineering such as low-code/no-code development, digital twins, etc.
*   Interplay between MBE with and for AI-based systems.
*   Application of MBE methods, tools, and techniques to specific domains, e.g., automotive, aerospace, cyber-physical systems, robotics, Artificial Intelligence or IoT.
*   Successful use of MBE in connection with other disciplines and approaches, such as Artificial Intelligence, DevOps, Open Source, or Safety Assurance.
*   Educational aspects of MBE.
*   Tools and initiatives for the successful adoption of MBE in industry.

## Review Criteria and Process

The program committee will assess all papers for novelty, significance, technical quality, rigor, and suitability for the conference. Papers accepted with revisions will be given a period to perform revisions and re-submit. Accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT.

## Artifacts

Artifacts are recommended but not required for the initial submission. Reviewers may consider the existence of artifacts positively, and they may be required for publication.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT. At least one author for each accepted paper must register before the early registration deadline and present the paper during the conference. Failure to do so will result in the paper being withdrawn from the proceedings.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Round 1 - Paper Submission:** Fri, Nov 22, 2024
*   **Round 1 - Abstract (Optional):** Fri, Nov 17, 2024
*   **Round 1 - Author Notification:** Fri, Nov 29, 2024
*   **Round 1 - Submissions of Revision:** Sun, Feb 9, 2025
*   **Round 2 - Paper Submission:** Fri, Jan 31, 2025
*   **Round 2 - Abstract (Optional):** Fri, Jan 17, 2025
*   **Round 2 - Author Notification:** Fri, Mar 28, 2025
*   **Round 2 - Submission of Revisions:** Sun, Feb 23, 2025
*   **Final Notification to Authors:** Sun, Apr 13, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Version:** Fri, May 2, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** Tue 10 Jun - Wed 11 Jun 2025

## Contact

*   **Email:** [ecmfa2025@easychair.org](mailto:ecmfa2025@easychair.org)
*   **Contact Form:** [https://conf.researchr.org/contact2/staf-2025/ecmfa-2025-papers](https://conf.researchr.org/contact2/staf-2025/ecmfa-2025-papers)

## Submission Link

[https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=staf2025](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=staf2025)

callForPapers:
# ICCSA 2025: Call for Papers

The 25th International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications (ICCSA 2025) will be organized in **Istanbul, Türkiye**, from **June 30 - July 3, 2025**, hosted by Galatasaray University.

ICCSA 2025 offers both **onsite and virtual participation options**, with virtual registration available at a reduced fee.

## Conference Themes

The conference themes are grouped into six tracks:

1.  **Track: Computational Methods, Algorithms and Scientific Application**
    *   Computational Biology
    *   Computational Combustion
    *   Computational Chemistry
    *   Computational Fluid Dynamics
    *   Computational Physics
    *   Computational Geometry
    *   Computational Mathematics
    *   Computational Mechanics
    *   Computational Electromagnetics
    *   Numerical Methods and Algorithms

2.  **Track: High-Performance Computing and Networks**
    *   Parallel and Distributed Computing
    *   Cluster Computing
    *   Supercomputing
    *   Cloud Computing
    *   Autonomic Computing
    *   P2P Computing
    *   Mobile Computing
    *   Grid and Semantic Grid Computing
    *   Workflow Design and Practice
    *   Computer and Network Architecture

3.  **Track: Geometric Modelling, Graphics and Visualization**
    *   Scientific Visualization
    *   Computer Graphics
    *   Geometric Modelling
    *   Pattern Recognition
    *   Image Processing
    *   CAD/CAM
    *   Web3D, Virtual and Augmented Reality

4.  **Track: Advanced and Emerging Applications**
    *   Biochemistry
    *   Bioinformatics
    *   Astrophysics
    *   Biometric Modelling
    *   Environmental, Climate and Weather Modelling
    *   Geology and Geophysics
    *   Nuclear Physics
    *   Financial and Economic Modelling
    *   Computational Journalism
    *   Geographical Information Systems

5.  **Track: Information Systems and Technologies**
    *   Information Retrieval
    *   Scientific Databases
    *   Security Engineering
    *   Risk Analysis
    *   Reliability Engineering
    *   Software Engineering
    *   Data Mining
    *   Artificial Intelligence
    *   Machine Learning
    *   Learning Technologies
    *   Web-Based Computing
    *   Web 2.0
    *   Blockchain

6.  **Track: Urban and Regional Planning**
    *   Urban and regional growth
    *   Sustainable urban and regional development
    *   Socio-ecological systems
    *   Open Data, Big Data
    *   Cultural Heritage
    *   Smart and Sustainable Cities
    *   Mobility and Intelligent Transport Systems
    *   Decision Support Systems
    *   Complexity assessment and mapping
    *   Logistics

## Submission Categories and Guidelines

*   **General Tracks and Workshops' Full Papers:** Submitted papers must be **between 12 and 18 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. Please consult href="https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors" - https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors for formatting information and templates.
*   **Short Papers:** Reporting preliminary results of ongoing research. Papers must be **between 8 and 11 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. Short papers will be presented during the conference and published by LNCS.
*   **PhD Showcase Papers:** Reporting ongoing research with significant results, primarily by PhD students and junior researchers. Papers must be **between 10 to 18 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. PhD Showcase Papers will be presented during the conference and published by LNCS.

Each paper must be original, unpublished, and not submitted elsewhere.

## Submission Process

Submissions must be made electronically through the Submission site: href="https://ess.iccsa.org" - https://ess.iccsa.org .

## Important Dates

*   **Start of Workshop proposal submission:** October 7, 2024
*   **Deadline for Workshop proposal submission:** November 7, 2024
*   **Start of Abstract and Paper Submission:** November 8, 2024
*   **Deadline for abstract and paper submission to General Tracks:** **March 28, 2025** (Workshops may have their own deadlines).
*   **Deadline for reviewers:** April 15, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 20, 2025
*   **Submission deadline for the final version (hard deadline):** **May 8, 2025**
*   **Registration and payment ends (hard deadline):** **May 8, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** June 30 - July 3, 2025

## Publication

All accepted papers will be included in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series. The proceedings are indexed by Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Thomson Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index, and other services. Authors of selected top-quality papers will be invited to submit extended versions for publication in special issues of recognized international journals.

## Review Process

Submitted papers will undergo a stringent peer review by at least three experts, evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity. The review method is Single Blind.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICCGV 2026

Submissions of papers for oral and poster presentations covering all aspects of Computer Graphics and Virtuality are welcome from scientists, engineers, researchers and practitioners world-wide. We are striving to ensure the broadest possible coverage of recent advances. In order for the scientific committee to develop appropriate oral and poster sessions for the program, we strongly encourage you to submit your abstract or full paper online.

## Topics of Interest

*   Computer Graphics
*   Images processing and computer vision
*   Rendering including real-time rendering, illumination, photo-realistic graphics
*   Computational photography
*   Graphics hardware, GPU, and hardware-related techniques
*   Image-based computer graphics
*   Geometric modeling, CAD, Simulation, Computer animation
*   image processing
*   Geometric data processing, GIS, BigData modeling and processing
*   Segmentation, Object Retrieval
*   Information visualization
*   Computer graphics and visualization
*   Scientific visualization, massive and BigData visualization
*   Computer vision
*   Virtual reality environments / augmented reality / mixed reality
*   Image scanning, display and printing
*   Volume graphics, semi-transparent media
*   Machine learning, computer graphics, biological vision
*   User interface design, and human-computer interaction, and advanced interaction
*   Storage and retrieval
*   Tracking and sensing
*   Input devices for VR/AR/MR
*   Advanced display technology
*   Immersive projection technology
*   Haptics, audio, and other non-visual interfaces
*   Modeling and simulation
*   Computer graphics techniques for VR/AR/MR
*   Virtual humans and avatars
*   Multi-user and distributed VR/AR/MR
*   VR systems and toolkits
*   Locomotion and navigation in virtual environments
*   User studies and evaluation
*   Perception, presence, virtual embodiment, and cognition
*   Teleoperation and telepresence
*   Applications of VR/AR/MR
*   Ethical issues in VR/AR/MR
*   Interactive storytelling in 360° videos
*   3D interaction for VR/AR/MR
*   3DUI metaphors for VR/AR/MR
*   Mobile, Desktop or Hybrid 3DUIs
*   Non-fatiguing 3DUIs
*   Evaluation methods for 3DUIs
*   Empirical studies of 3DUIs
*   Applications of 3DUIs: Games, entertainment, CAD, education, etc.

## Submission Method

Please log in the [Online Submission System](https://www.zmeeting.org/submission/iccgv2026) and submit your full paper or abstract before the submission deadline.

*   [Paper Template (.tex)](index.html)
*   [Paper Template (.doc)](index.html)
*   [Abstract Template(.doc)](index.html)

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** September 30, 2025
*   **Paper Acceptance Notification:** October 30, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Paper Submission:** November 15, 2025
*   **Registration Deadline:** November 15, 2025

## Publication

After a careful reviewing process, all accepted papers after proper registration and presentation will be published in the ICCGV 2026 Conference Proceedings, which will be submitted to be indexed by Ei Compendex, Scopus.

# IEEE International Conference on Data Science and Engineering (ICDSE 2025): Call for Contributions

ICDE 2025, the 41st IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering, will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China, from May 19 – 23, 2025**. ICDE is a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and exchange techniques, tools, and experiences in data and information engineering.

## Calls for Contributions

*   [Call for Research Paper](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-contributions/)
*   [Call for Industry and Application Papers](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-industry-and-application-papers/)
*   [Call for Demonstrations](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-demonstrations/)
*   [Call for Workshop Proposal](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-workshop-proposal/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-tutorials/)
*   [Call for TKDE Poster](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-tkde-poster/)
*   [Call for PhD Symposium Submissions](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-phd-symposium-submissions/)
*   [Call for Data Engineering Future Technologies](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-data-engineering-future-technologies/)

## Call for Research Papers

### Topics of Interest

We invite original research contributions in the following areas as they relate to data management:

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI
*   Benchmarking, Performance Modeling, Tuning, and Testing
*   Cloud Data Management
*   Crowdsourcing and Data Management
*   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Data Models, Semantics, Query languages
*   Data Stream Systems and Edge Computing
*   Very Large Data Visualization and Interactive Data Exploration
*   Database Security and Privacy
*   Distributed Ledgers and Blockchains
*   Distributed, Parallel and P2P Data Management
*   Explainability, Fairness, and Trust in Data Systems and Analysis
*   Graphs, Networks, and Semi-structured Data Management
*   Information Integration and Data Quality
*   IoT Data Management
*   Modern Hardware and In-Memory Database Systems
*   Query Processing, Indexing, and Optimization
*   Transaction Management
*   Spatial Databases and Temporal Databases
*   Text, Semi-Structured Data Management, Multimedia Databases
*   Information Retrieval from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Uncertain, Probabilistic, and Approximate Databases
*   Very Large Data Science Applications/Pipelines
*   Workflows, Scientific Data Management

We also welcome any original contributions that may cross the boundaries among areas or point in other novel directions of interest to the database research community.

### Important Dates

ICDE 2025 will have two rounds of research paper submissions.

*All deadlines are 11:59 PM AoE.*

**First Round:**

*   **Submission due:** August 2, 2024
*   **Notification for authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** September 24, 2024
*   **Revision due:** October 29, 2024
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** November 26, 2024
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** December 10, 2024

**Second Round:**

*   **Submission due:** November 25, 2024
*   **Notification for Authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** January 21, 2025
*   **Revision Due:** February 25, 2025
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** March 25, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** April 8, 2025

### Submission Guidelines

*   Paper should be submitted using the Conference Management Tool: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025).
*   Manuscripts must be prepared in accordance with the IEEE format available at [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   Research papers must not exceed **12 pages**, not including references. No appendix is allowed.
*   Only electronic submissions in PDF format will be considered.
*   A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work.
*   A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 must present original work not described in any prior publication that is more than 4 double-column pages in length.
*   Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than 10 submitted research papers across the two submission rounds.
*   Submissions will be reviewed in a **single-blind manner**.
*   Submissions that are rejected in the first round of the IEEE ICDE 2025 research track are not eligible for re-submission to the second round.
*   The best papers (as judged by the ICDE 2025 PC) will be selected for submission as an extended version to be published in the IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE).

### Desk Rejection Policy

ICDE research track submissions that don’t meet the following requirements may be rejected without review:

*   Submissions must follow the aforementioned guidelines and length requirements specified in the ICDE 2025 Call for Papers.
*   Submissions must be in scope of ICDE 2025, aligning with at least one of the topic areas and situating itself within the state of the art of current and past research in the database community.
*   Authors must correctly declare all conflicts of interest (COI) with members of the program committee.

### Conflict of Interest (COI) Declaration

*   Each author of a submission must create a CMT profile and complete it with domain and individual conflicts.
*   If a CMT profile is missing for at least one author of a submission, the paper will be desk rejected.
*   Authors can mark their conflicts by clicking on their name (upper right-hand side on CMT) and selecting “Domain Conflicts” and “Individual Conflicts”.
*   A searchable spreadsheet of COIs is available for authors' convenience.

### Reviewing Process

*   Papers will be stringently reviewed with at least 3 reviews per paper.
*   Revisions: Papers may be invited for revision. Authors will have five weeks to prepare their revisions. The revision process is intended to be a constructive interaction between reviewers and authors.

### Diversity and Inclusion

We value Diversity and Inclusion in our community and profession. Be mindful in your writing of not using language or examples that further the marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group of people. Reviewers will be empowered to monitor and demand changes if such issues arise.

### Acceptance and Attendance

IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution (e.g., remove it from IEEE Xplore) after the conference if none of the authors attend the conference to present their paper.

callForPapers:
# ICIAP 2025: Call for Papers

The 23rd International Conference on Image Analysis and Processing (ICIAP 2025) is organized by CVPL, the Italian Member Society of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR). The conference will take place in **Rome, Italy**, from **September 15-19, 2025**, at the **Sapienza University of Rome**.

The conference focuses on both traditional and emerging trends in computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, addressing both theoretical and practical aspects.

## Topics of Interest

*   Video Analysis and Understanding
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Multiview Geometry and 3D Computer Vision
*   Image Analysis, Detection, and Recognition
*   Multimedia
*   Biomedical and Assistive Technology
*   Digital Forensics and Biometrics
*   Image Processing for Cultural Heritage
*   Robot and Vision
*   Brave New Ideas
*   AI and science
*   X-Realities
*   Embedded Vision

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be handled electronically via the conference’s CMT Website: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025)

*   **Template Download:** [Link to Template](Template Download)
*   **Overleaf Template:** [Link to Overleaf Template](Overleaf Template)
*   The maximum number of pages is **12 including references**.

## Review Process

*   Papers will be selected through a **double-blind review process**.
*   Each submission will be managed by two Area Chairs and reviewed by at least three reviewers.
*   **Anonymization:** Do not provide information that may identify the authors in the acknowledgments or any other part of the paper. Do not provide links to websites that identify the authors (e.g., GitHub repositories). Violation of these guidelines may lead to rejection without review.
*   **Dual Submissions:** Submissions must not have been previously published or accepted for publication in substantially similar form. No publication substantially similar in content (20% or more overlap) should be submitted to another venue during the review period.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the ICIAP 2025 Conference Proceedings, which will be published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science series (LNCS)**.

## Important Dates

**First Round:**

*   **Submission:** 14 February 2025
*   **Notification to Authors:** 31 March 2025

**Second Round:**

*   **Submission:** 15 April 2025 (extended to 29 April 2025 AoE)
*   **Notification to Authors:** 15 June 2025

**Conference:**

*   **Workshop and Tutorials:** 15 - 16 September 2025
*   **Main Conference:** 17 - 19 September 2025

**Author Deadlines:**

*   **Early Bird registration deadline:** 30 June 2025
*   **Authors’ Registration deadline:** 30 June 2025
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** 10 July 2025
*   **Regular registration deadline:** 4 September 2025

### Registration Notes

*   Authors of accepted papers must register before submitting the final camera-ready version and include the abstract code in the registration form.
*   Each accepted paper must be covered by at least one full (regular or member) registration.
*   Papers exceeding the first can be covered by the "additional paper" fee at 150.00€ each.

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact us at [info@iciap.org](mailto:info@iciap.org).

callForPapers:
# ICICS 2025: Call for Papers

The 27th International Conference on Information and Communications Security (ICICS 2025) will be held in **Nanjing, China**, during **October 29-31, 2025**. The conference will be organized by **Southeast University, China**.

ICICS seeks submissions presenting novel contributions related to information and communication security.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of particular interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Access control
*   AI-based security and privacy
*   Anonymity
*   Applied cryptography
*   Attestation
*   Authentication and authorization
*   Biometrics security
*   Blockchain security and privacy
*   Cloud computing security
*   Critical infrastructure protection
*   Cyber-physical systems security
*   Cyber threat intelligence
*   Data security and privacy
*   Digital forensics
*   Digital rights management
*   Digital watermarking
*   Distributed systems security
*   Edge and fog computing security
*   Embedded systems security
*   Formal methods for security
*   Hardware security
*   Identity management
*   Information security management
*   Intrusion detection and prevention
*   Malware and unwanted software
*   Mobile security and privacy
*   Online safety and child protection
*   Online social media security, privacy, and trust
*   Operating systems security
*   Network security
*   Privacy enhancing technologies
*   Secure communication protocols
*   Secure information flow
*   Secure systems design and architectures
*   Security and privacy for the (Industrial) Internet of Things
*   Security and privacy of AI
*   Security visualization
*   Software and application security
*   Steganography and steganalysis
*   Trusted computing
*   Trust management and reputation
*   Web security and privacy

## Important Dates

All submissions must be received by 11:59 p.m. (Beijing Time: UTC/GMT +8.00) on the day of the corresponding deadline.

### Paper Submission

*   **First round submission deadline:** February 28, 2025
*   **First round notification:** March 9, 2025

*   **Second round submission deadline:** May 23, 2025
*   **Second round notification:** July 21, 2025

## Publication

Springer sponsors ICICS 2025 with 1000 EUR for a Best Paper Award and a Best Student Paper Award.

The conference proceedings are published by Springer in their Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series.

## Registration

All general papers require a full registration.

# Call for Papers: ICSE 2025 - IEEE International Conference on Software Engineering

Welcome to ICSE 2025, the premier international conference on Software Engineering, celebrating its 50th anniversary!

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** April 27 - May 3, 2025
*   **Core Conference Days:** April 30 - May 2, 2025
*   **Location:** Ottawa, Ontario, Canada
*   **Venue:** Rogers Centre, Ottawa (formerly Shaw Centre)
*   **Reception Venue:** National Arts Centre

## Tracks

ICSE 2025 featured a comprehensive program with various tracks, including:

*   **Main Plenaries**
*   **Panels and Special Sessions**
*   **Research Track**
*   **Software Engineering in Practice (SEIP)**
*   **Software Engineering in Society (SEIS)**
*   **New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER)**
*   **Journal-first Papers**
*   **Demonstrations**
*   **Artifact Evaluation**
*   **Industry Challenge Track**
*   **Software Engineering Education**
*   **Posters**
*   **Doctoral Symposium**
*   **Shadow PC**
*   **Workshops**
*   **Tutorials and Technical Briefings**
*   **New Faculty Symposium**
*   **Symposium on Software Engineering in the Global South (SEiGS)**
*   **SRC - ACM Student Research Competition**
*   **Social, Networking and Special Rooms**
*   **Meetings and BOFs**
*   **Student Mentoring Workshop (SMeW)**
*   **Student Volunteers**

## Co-hosted Conferences

ICSE 2025 was co-hosted with several other conferences, including:

*   AST 2025 (Automation of Software Test)
*   CAIN 2025 (SE for Artificial Intelligence)
*   CHASE 2025 (Cooperative and Human Aspects of SE)
*   CSEE&T 2025 (Software Engineering Education)
*   FORGE 2025 (AI Foundation Models and SE)
*   FormaliSE 2025
*   ICPC 2025 (Program Comprehension)
*   ICSR 2025 (Software Reuse)
*   MOBILESoft 2025 (Mobile SE and Systems)
*   MSR 2025 (Mining Software Repositories)
*   SEAMS 2025 (Adaptive And Self-Managing Systems)
*   TechDebt 2025 (Technical Debt)

## Key Information for Attendees

*   **Registration:** Information available online or in person at the registration desk. The desk opened at 8 a.m. on Sunday, April 27th.
*   **Virtual Attendance:** Options are available for virtual participation.
*   **Presenting:** Information for presenters is provided.
*   **Food:** Details on food availability at the conference.
*   **Activities:** Information on fun activities and networking events.
*   **Social Media:** Links to ICSE social media channels.
*   **Accommodation:** Hotel information is available.
*   **Travel:** Guidance on getting around Ottawa, traveling to Ottawa, and travel support.
*   **Visa and Travel Authorization:** Information for international attendees.
*   **Code of Conduct:** Policies for maintaining a respectful and inclusive environment.
*   **Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Plan:** Commitment to fostering an inclusive conference.
*   **Sustainability:** Information on the conference's sustainability initiatives.
*   **FAQ:** Frequently Asked Questions.

## Publication

The proceedings are available [here](https://conf.researchr.org/info/icse-2025/proceedings).

## News

*   ICSE Keynote talks are available on the YouTube Channel.
*   SEAMS 2025 Wrap-up: A successful event with high-quality program and lively discussions.
*   ICSE2025 Program is now Final!
*   Last chance for most ICSE hotels is March 25th!

See you all in 2026 in Rio!

summary: The International Conference on Information Systems Security and Privacy (ICISSP) 2026 is scheduled to take place from March 4-6, 2026. This event aims to foster discussions among researchers and practitioners on the latest advancements concerning the technological, social, and regulatory challenges in information systems security, privacy, and trust. ICISSP 2026 is a hybrid event, offering both in-person and remote participation options, and is being held in conjunction with several other conferences, including ICAART 2026, PHOTOPTICS 2026, ICPRAM 2026, BIOSTEC 2026, and ROBOVIS 2026. The specific venue is yet to be announced.
callForPapers:
# ICISSP 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Information Systems Security and Privacy (ICISSP) 2026 is an event where researchers and practitioners can meet and discuss state-of-the-art research about the technological, social, and regulatory challenges that regard the security, privacy, and trust of modern information systems. The conference welcomes papers of either practical or theoretical nature, and is interested in research or applications addressing all aspects of trust, security and privacy, and encompassing issues of concern for organizations, individuals and society at large.

ICISSP 2026 is held in conjunction with ICAART 2026, PHOTOPTICS 2026, ICPRAM 2026, BIOSTEC 2026 and ROBOVIS 2026. Registration to ICISSP allows free access to the other co-located conferences (as a non-speaker). Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person) speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Conference Areas

Papers may address one or more of the listed sub-topics, although authors should not feel limited by them. Unlisted but related sub-topics are also acceptable, provided they fit in one of the following main topic areas:

1.  **MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS**
    *   Regulatory and Technical Compliance Aspects of Security and Privacy
    *   Risk and Reputation Management
    *   Identity and Trust Management
    *   Threat Awareness
    *   Intrusion Detection and Response
    *   Security Awareness and Education
    *   Malware Detection
    *   Vulnerability Analysis and Countermeasures
    *   Security and Privacy Metrics

2.  **APPLICATIONS AND SERVICES**
    *   Web Applications and Services
    *   Web 3.0 Security and Privacy
    *   Security and Privacy in Cloud and Pervasive Computing
    *   Privacy, Security and Trust in Social Media, Metaverse, and other Online Contexts
    *   AI and Machine Learning for Security
    *   Security in IoT and Edge Computing
    *   Mobile Security

3.  **TECHNOLOGIES AND FOUNDATIONS**
    *   Trusted Computing
    *   Access and Usage Control
    *   Security Testing
    *   Data and Software Security
    *   Privacy-Enhancing Models and Technologies
    *   Privacy and Security Models
    *   Cryptographic Algorithms
    *   Security Frameworks, Architectures and Protocols
    *   Authentication, Biometrics, Identification
    *   Security Architecture and Design Analysis

## Keynote Speakers

ICISSP 2026 will have several invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts in their areas. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a complete paper or an abstract, but please note that accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings of the conference. Complete papers can be submitted as a **Regular Paper**, representing completed and validated research, or as a **Position Paper**, portraying a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue discussing ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures or results of scientific research focused on one of the conference topic areas.

Authors should submit a paper in English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling, addressing one or several of the conference areas or topics. Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution, and the problems, domains or environments to which it is applicable. To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including the authors’ personal details, the acknowledgments section of the paper and any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.

When submitting a complete paper please note that only original papers should be submitted. Authors are advised to read **INSTICC's ethical norms** regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism thoroughly before submitting and must make sure that their submissions do not substantially overlap work which has been published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to a journal or another conference with proceedings. Papers that contain any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Authors should also avoid using an excessive number of self-citations.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS** and should follow the instructions and templates that can be found under Guidelines and Templates. After the paper submission has been successfully completed, authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and on digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef ([http://www.crossref.org/](http://www.crossref.org/)) and every paper on our digital library is given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.
*   It is planned to publish a short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers with **Springer** in a CCIS Series book (final approval pending).
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the **Springer Nature Computer Science Journal**.

## Important Dates

All dates refer to AOE time, i.e. "Anywhere on Earth".

*   **Conference Dates:** March 4 - 6, 2026

*   **Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: **October 2, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **December 4, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **December 19, 2025**

*   **Position Papers / Regular Papers:**
    *   Paper Submission: **November 13, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **December 19, 2025**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **January 13, 2026**

*   **Abstracts Track:**
    *   Abstract Submission: **December 17, 2025**
    *   Authors Notification: **January 14, 2026**
    *   Camera Ready and Registration: **January 22, 2026**

*   **Workshops:**
    *   Workshop Proposal: **October 29, 2025**

*   **Special Sessions:**
    *   Special Session Proposal: **October 29, 2025**

*   **Tutorials:**
    *   Tutorial Proposal: **January 23, 2026**

*   **Demos:**
    *   Demo Proposal: **January 23, 2026**

*   **Panels:**
    *   Panel Proposal: **January 23, 2026**

## Secretariat

*   **ICISSP Secretariat**
*   Address: Avenida de S. Francisco Xavier, Lote 7 Cv. C, 2900-616 Setúbal - Portugal
*   Tel.: +351 265 520 185
*   Fax: +351 265 520 186
*   e-mail: [icissp.secretariat@insticc.org](mailto:icissp.secretariat@insticc.org)
*   Web: [https://icissp.scitevents.org](https://icissp.scitevents.org)

## Venue

Available soon.

## Chairs

*   **Conference Chair:** Paolo Mori, Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche, Italy
*   **Program Co-Chairs:**
    *   Roberto Di Pietro, KAUST, Saudi Arabia
    *   Karen Renaud, University of Strathclyde, United Kingdom

## Program Committee

The Program Committee includes a comprehensive list of members from various institutions worldwide.

callForPapers:
# ICITA 2025: Call for Papers

The 19th International Conference on Information Technology and Applications (ICITA 2025) will be held in **Oslo, Norway** from **October 14 - 16, 2025**. This conference is a recognized major event in Information Technology, continuing its tradition of high quality and facilitating cross-disciplinary and social gatherings.

### Theme of the Conference

*   **Algorithms, Analytics and AI Applications**

### Conference Tracks

*   Big Data Analytics
*   Software Engineering
*   Blockchain
*   Cloud computing
*   Computer Graphics and Games Programming
*   Computer Networks
*   Computer Vision and Image Processing
*   Cybersecurity
*   Data Science
*   Digital Health
*   Evolutionary Computing
*   VR/VA and Games Applications in Industry
*   Human Computer Interaction
*   Information and Knowledge Management
*   Internet of Things and Cyber-Physical Systems
*   Machine learning
*   Mobile Computing
*   Digital Education
*   eCommerce

## Types of Submissions

*   **Full Papers:** Finished or consolidated R&D work, assigned a **10-page limit**. These will be included in the conference proceedings.
*   **Short Papers:** Ongoing works with relevant preliminary results, open to discussion, assigned a **10-page limit**. These will be included in the conference proceedings.
*   **Poster Papers:** Not published in the Conference Proceedings, only presented and discussed. Authors must print a poster in **A1 vertical format**. Presentations have a **7-minute limit** per poster.
*   **Company Papers:** Not published in the Conference Proceedings, only presented and discussed.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submitted papers must comply with the format of **Lecture Notes in Network Systems Series**. Authors are requested to follow the Instructions for Authors on the [Springer Website](https://www.springer.com/de/authors-editors/book-authors-editors/resources-guidelines/book-manuscript-guidelines/manuscript-preparation/5636).
*   Papers must be written in English.
*   Submissions must not have been published before, nor be under review for any other conference or publication.
*   **Anonymization:** Versions for evaluation must not include author names, affiliations, or bibliographic references leading to the authors’ identification. This information should only be included in the camera-ready version.
*   All files (submission, camera-ready) need to be compressed (e.g., a ZIP file) and uploaded at the conference management system.
*   A filled 'Consent to Publish' form must accompany the camera-ready files.

## Review Process

All papers will be subjected to a **"double-blind review"** by at least three members of the Program Committee.

## Publication and Indexing

*   **Full papers** accepted and registered will be published in **Proceedings by Springer, in Lecture Notes in Network System series**. They will be submitted for indexation by **ISI, SCOPUS, and Google Scholar**, among others, and will be available in the SpringerLink Digital Library.
*   **Poster and company papers will not be published**, only presented at the conference.
*   To ensure publication, at least one author must be **fully registered by September 5, 2025**, and the paper must comply with the suggested layout and page-limit. All recommended changes must be addressed before submitting the camera-ready version.

## Important Dates

### Paper Submission Dates

*   **Conference paper/submission deadline:** [Changed or passed: June 30, 2025]
*   **15th July 2025:** (Potentially a secondary deadline or for specific categories)
*   **Submission for online papers Only:** August 5, 2025
*   **Conference paper notification:** August 26, 2025
*   **Registration Deadline:** September 5, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** September 5, 2025

### Workshop/Special Session Dates

*   **Workshop/Special Session Proposal:** May 5, 2025
*   **Notification of Workshop/Special Acceptance:** June 5, 2025
*   **Workshop Final Information and Program Committee:** June 15, 2025
*   **Deadline for paper submission (for workshop/special session):** July 5, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance (for workshop/special session):** July 25, 2025
*   **Camera ready paper and registration (Strict) (for workshop/special session):** July 30, 2025

## Contact

To sponsor the event, contact [chair@icita.world](mailto:chair@icita.world).

callForPapers:
# ICDT 2026: Call for Papers

ICDT (International Conference on Database Theory) is a series of international scientific conferences focused on research in the foundations and theory of data management. Since 2009, ICDT has been held annually and jointly with EDBT (Extending Database Technology).

The **29th edition of ICDT in 2026** is planned to take place in **Tampere, Finland, from March 24 to March 27, 2026**.

## Topics of Interest

We welcome research papers on every topic related to the principles and theory of data management, provided that there is a clear connection to foundational aspects. This includes:

*   Theoretical investigation of data management systems (e.g., Indexes, Concurrency and recovery, Distributed and parallel databases, Cloud computing, Privacy and security, Graph databases, Data streams and sketching, Data-centric process management, Data and knowledge integration, Data provenance, Views, Data warehouses, Domain-specific databases).
*   Design and study of data models and query languages.
*   Development and analysis of algorithms for data management.
*   Connections between data management and other areas such as knowledge representation, semantic web, web services, information retrieval and data mining, machine learning/AI, distributed computing, and theoretical computer science.

A clear emphasis on foundational aspects is expected for all submissions. The Program Committee reserves the right to desk reject submissions considered out of scope.

## Submission Cycles and Dates

ICDT will have two submission cycles for 2026:

### ICDT Submission Cycle 1

*   **Abstract submission:** March 13, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Paper submission:** March 20, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification:** June 1, 2025

### ICDT Submission Cycle 2

*   **Abstract submission:** September 3, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Paper submission:** September 10, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification:** December 1, 2025

*Note: Papers rejected in the first submission cycle cannot be submitted to the second submission cycle unless explicitly requested by the reviewers.*

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be electronic via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdt2026](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdt2026)

*   Papers must be written in English and provide sufficient detail for assessment.
*   Papers must be submitted as PDF documents, using the LIPIcs style (http://www.dagstuhl.de/en/publications/lipics/instructions-for-authors).

## Tracks

1.  **Regular Research Papers** (15 pages, anonymized)
    *   Results must be unpublished and not submitted elsewhere.
    *   Maximum 15 pages, excluding references. Appendices are at the discretion of the PC.
    *   Papers must conform to LIPIcs formatting requirements.

2.  **Database Theory in Action** (4 pages + references, non-anonymized)
    *   Short papers illustrating applications of database theory in other domains or real-world problems.
    *   Can be based on previously published work.
    *   Titles must start with "Database Theory in Action:".
    *   Include pointers to relevant publications, websites, tools, etc.

## Publication

The proceedings will appear in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series, available online and free of charge. Authors retain rights over their work.

At least one author of each accepted paper is expected to register for the conference and present the paper.

## Anonymous Submission (for Regular Research Papers)

*   Submitted papers must not list authors or affiliations, nor include acknowledgments.
*   References to authors' own prior work must be anonymized.
*   Anonymized citations are permissible where necessary (e.g., referring to a system with privileged access).
*   Authors may make submissions available via pre-print services (e.g., ArXiv), but should not label work as "under submission at ICDT" or indicate it is under review.

## Awards

*   **Best Paper Award**
*   **Best Newcomer Paper Award** (preferentially for student-only papers, then called Best Student-Paper Award).

The program committee reserves the right to not give awards, to split awards, and to define "newcomer". Papers by program committee members are eligible for awards, with procedures to avoid conflicts of interest.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: MFCS 2025

The 50th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science (MFCS 2025) will be held from **August 25 – 29, 2025**, in **Warsaw, Poland**. MFCS is a high-quality venue for original research in all branches of Theoretical Computer Science and has a history dating back to 1972.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** April 18, 2025 (Anywhere on Earth)
*   **Rebuttal:** June 3–6, 2025
*   **Author notification:** June 20, 2025
*   **Camera-ready version:** July 1, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Registration opens:** July 1, 2025
*   **Early registration:** July 18, 2025 (AoE)
*   **YRF submission deadline:** August 1, 2025
*   **Conference:** August 25–29, 2025 (YRF Workshop on August 24)

## Registration

At least one of the authors of each accepted paper must register by **July 18** (Early registration phase) for the paper to appear in the proceedings.

Students who at the time of the conference have not yet completed their PhD qualify for the student status of the registration.

| Attendee | Early (until July 18) | Late (from July 18) |
|---|---|---|
| Regular | **2000 PLN** | **2450 PLN** |
| Student | **1550 PLN** | **2000 PLN** |

All fees are in Polish złotys. Early registration deadline is **July 18, 23:59 (AoE)**.

Registration fee includes:
*   participation in all conference sessions,
*   coffee breaks,
*   reception on Aug 25,
*   conference dinner on Aug 27.

The conference fee does not include lunches.

Complete your registration online by filling out this form: [MFCS 2025 registration](https://forms.gle/ThuSfEeAaHUJhwEv5).

### Payment

All fees are to be paid by a bank transfer in PLN.

**BENEFICIARY:**
Uniwersytet Warszawski
ul. Krakowskie Przedmiescie 26/28
00-927 Warszawa

**BANK NAME:** Bank Millennium SA
**IBAN:** PL67 1160 2202 0000 0000 6084 9250
**SWIFT:** BIGBPLPW

Transfer reference template: `MFCS2025 <first name> <last name>`.

Transfers should reach the organiser's account by **August 14, 2025**; otherwise the registration may be rejected.

### Cancellation Policy

Cancellation requests should be sent by e-mail to [mfcs2025@mimuw.edu.pl](mailto:mfcs2025@mimuw.edu.pl).

*   Cancellations received by **July 25** will be eligible for registration fees refund, minus **300 PLN** of administrative fee.
*   Cancellations received after **July 25** and no-shows will not be eligible for a refund.

## Topics

The program committee encourages submission of original research papers in all areas of theoretical computer science, including (but not limited to) the following:

*   algebraic and co-algebraic methods in computer science
*   algorithms and data structures
*   automata and formal languages
*   bioinformatics
*   combinatorics on words, trees, and other structures
*   computational complexity (structural and model-related)
*   computational geometry
*   computer-aided verification
*   computer assisted reasoning
*   concurrency theory
*   cryptography and security
*   cyber physical systems, databases and knowledge-based systems
*   formal specifications and program development
*   foundations of computing
*   logics in computer science
*   mobile computing
*   models of computation
*   networks
*   parallel and distributed computing
*   quantum computing
*   semantics and verification of programs
*   theoretical issues in artificial intelligence and machine learning
*   types in computer science

## Young Researchers Forum (YRF 2025)

Just before MFCS 2025, on **August 24, 2025**, the Young Researchers Forum (YRF 2025) will take place at the MFCS Conference venue. This one-day event aims to provide a platform for young researchers, including master’s students, PhD candidates and postdocs, to present and discuss their recent or ongoing work in theoretical computer science in a broad sense, as well as to engage with and learn from more experienced researchers.

All MFCS 2025 participants are warmly invited to attend the sessions of YRF 2025.

The program will consist of:
*   session of contributed talks of published, submitted, or in-progress works,
*   session of invited non-technical talks addressing various aspects of life and career of young researchers,
*   a panel discussion between early-career participants and seasoned researchers, covering various aspects of academic life and research,
*   a poster session.

The event will run from 9:30 to 19:00. A detailed schedule will be announced early August.

Registration is free but required as part of the MFCS 2025 registration process.

If you wish to present a talk or a poster, please fill out the [submission form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScthLjW7pwpeiF88hoIWEerRSDLE79tpBlM4hD1rjhlGoLWpQ/viewform?usp=dialog) before **August 1st**.

For inquiries about YRF 2025, please contact Bartłomiej Dudek or Lorenzo Clemente.

callForPapers:
# IEEE MASS 2025: Call for Papers

We are pleased to invite you to submit original contributions to IEEE MASS 2025. This can include technical and experimental, theoretical, and conceptual contributions. All original, unpublished contributions are solicited in all aspects of mobile ad hoc networks (MANETs) and smart systems, from mobile networking/computing to cyber-physical systems to the Internet of Things, from theory to systems and applications.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   5G/6G networks and technologies
*   AI/ML for smart wireless networks
*   AI and machine learning aided protocol design and resource allocation
*   AI and machine learning based applications for ad hoc networks
*   Algorithms for MANETs and WSNs
*   Application Layer Protocols
*   Clustering, topology control, coverage, and connectivity
*   Cognitive networking
*   Cooperative and cognitive communication
*   Cooperative sensing, compressive sensing, sensing from communications
*   Cloud, crowd-sourced, participatory and (mobile) social sensing
*   Cyber-physical systems and applications
*   Data gathering, fusion, and dissemination
*   Energy-efficient architectures, algorithms, and protocols
*   Experiences in real-world applications and deployments
*   Flying Ad-Hoc Networks
*   Free-space optical networks
*   Heterogeneous networks
*   Internet of Things (IoT) devices, gateways, and infrastructure
*   Light-weight distributed machine learning
*   Localization and Location Based Services
*   Measurements, experimental systems and test-beds
*   Mobile computing and networking
*   mmWave and Terahertz networks
*   Mobility modeling and management
*   Multi-channel, multi-radio and MIMO technologies
*   Network components, operating systems, and middleware
*   Opportunistic networking, delay tolerant networking
*   QoS and Resource management
*   Robotic networks
*   Routing protocols
*   Scalability, stability, and robustness of networks and sensor systems
*   Security and privacy at all layers, including the physical layer
*   Sensor enabled drone, UAV, UUV systems
*   Smart grid, healthcare, transportation applications
*   Vehicular networks and protocols
*   Visible light communications
*   Wearable and human-centric devices and networks

All submissions will be peer-reviewed based on relevance, originality, importance, and clarity.

## Submission Guidelines and Proceedings

Authors are invited to submit original, unpublished research papers that are not currently under review elsewhere. All submissions should be written in English with a maximum length of **9 single-spaced, double-column pages** using 10pt fonts on 8.5 in x 11 in paper, including all figures, tables, and references, in PDF format.

Authors must use the [Manuscript Templates for IEEE Conference Proceedings](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).

Reviewing will be **single-blind**, i.e., authors can keep their names on their submitted paper.

Accepted papers will appear in the conference proceedings published by IEEE and will be presented at the conference. Based on TPC reviews and discussions, some papers may be accepted as 5-page short papers or 2-page posters in addition to the regular 9-page papers.

For each accepted paper to be published in the IEEE MASS 2025 Proceedings and IEEE Xplore, at least one author is required to register and attend the conference. The paper must be presented by an author listed on the paper. Substitute presenters, due to unforeseen circumstances or verifiable excuses, must be authorized in advance by the TPC Chairs. Unauthorized substitute presentations will result in the paper not being added to the IEEE digital archive of the conference proceedings.

## Important Dates (EDT)

*   **Paper Submission Due:** Wednesday, May 07, 2025 (firm deadline)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** Tuesday, July 15, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Version:** Friday, August 15, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** October 6-8, 2025

## Submission System

[EDAS](https://edas.info/N33357)

callForPapers:
# CALL FOR PAPERS: MFPS XLI (MFPS 2025)

The 41st Conference on Mathematical Foundations of Programming Semantics (MFPS 2025) will take place from **June 18-20, 2025**, at the **University of Strathclyde in Glasgow, Scotland**. This conference is held **jointly with CALCO**.

## About MFPS

MFPS conferences are dedicated to the areas of mathematics, logic, and computer science that are related to models of computation in general, and to semantics of programming languages in particular. It serves as a forum for researchers in mathematics and computer science to exchange ideas, and participation from neighbouring areas is strongly encouraged.

### Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   bio-computation
*   concurrent qualitative and quantitative distributed systems
*   process calculi
*   probabilistic systems
*   constructive mathematics
*   domain theory and categorical models
*   formal languages
*   formal methods
*   game semantics
*   lambda calculus
*   programming-language theory
*   quantum computation
*   security
*   topological models
*   logic
*   type systems
*   type theory
*   denotational and operational semantics
*   rewrite theory
*   proof theory
*   Applications of semantics to novel areas

### Participation

Participation in the meeting is expected to be **in person**. One author of every accepted paper must attend the meeting and give the presentation. Exceptions may be considered for unexpected problems with travel or visas.

## Important Dates (Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Abstract Submission:** April 8, 2025 (extended)
*   **Full-Paper Submission:** April 9, 2025 (extended)
*   **Author Notification:** May 15, 2025 (extended)
*   **Conference Paper:** May 24, 2025
*   **Final (post-proceeding) versions:** Autumn 2025

## Invited Speakers

*   **Gordon Plotkin** (keynote, joint with CALCO)
*   Chris Heunen
*   Delia Kesner
*   Jurriaan Rot

## Special Sessions

*   **Quantitative Semantics**, organized by Ugo Dal Lago (joint session with CALCO)
*   **Mathematics of Natural Language**, organized by Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh
*   **Types and the Extraction of Correct Programs**, organized by Ulrich Berger

## Program Committee

*   Sandra Alves (University of Porto, Portugal)
*   Giorgio Bacci (Aalborg University, Denmark)
*   Lars Birkedal (University of Aarhus, Denmark)

*   Shin-ya Katsumata (NII, Tokyo, Japan)
*   S. Krishna (IIT Bombay, India)
*   Clemens Kupke (University of Strathclyde, Scotland (co-chair))
*   Elena di Lavore (University of Oxford, UK)
*   Paul Levy (University of Birmingham, UK)
*   Isabella Mastroeni (University of Verona, Italy)
*   Stefan Milius (FAU Erlangen-Nürnberg, Germany (co-chair))
*   Daniele Nantes-Sobrinho (Imperial College London, UK)
*   Fredrik Nordvall Forsberg (University of Strathclyde, Scotland)
*   Catuscia Palamidessi (Inria, France)
*   Prakash Panangaden (McGill University, Montreal, Canada)
*   Simon Perdrix (Inria LORIA, France)
*   Elaine Pimentel (University College London, UK)
*   Alex Simpson (University of Ljubljana, Slovenia)
*   Sam Staton (University of Oxford, UK)
*   Dario Stein (Radboud University Nijmegen, The Netherlands)
*   Qiyi Tang (University of Liverpool, UK)
*   Stelios Tsampas (FAU Erlangen-Nürnberg, Germany)

## MFPS Organizers

*   Andrej Bauer (University of Ljubljana, Slovenia)
*   Lars Birkedal (Aarhus University, Denmark)
*   Stephen Brookes (Carnegie Mellon University, USA)
*   Achim Jung (University of Birmingham, UK)

## Local Organizer

*   Clemens Kupke (University of Strathclyde)
*   Bob Atkey (University of Strathclyde)
*   Dilsat Bilal Yuksel (University of Strathclyde)

## Submission Instructions

*   Submissions are made through **EasyChair**: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=mfps2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=mfps2025)
*   Papers can be **at most 15 pages long**, excluding bibliography.
*   Papers should be prepared using the **MFPS macros**: [https://mfpsconf.org/submissions-to-mfps/](https://mfpsconf.org/submissions-to-mfps/)
*   Proofs omitted due to space limitations may be included in a clearly marked appendix, to be consulted at the discretion of program committee members.

## Proceedings

A preliminary version will be distributed at the meeting. Final proceedings will be published in **Electronic Notes in Theoretical Informatics and Computer Science (ENTICS)**. This open-access series is hosted by Episciences.org as an overlay for papers published by the CORR arXiv or HAL.

## Contact

For any further information about MFPS 2025, please contact the co-chairs:

*   **Clemens Kupke**
*   **Stefan Milius**

callForPapers:
# MEDES 2025: Call For Papers

The International Conference on Management of Digital EcoSystems (MEDES) aims to bring together a diverse community from academia, research laboratories and industry interested in exploring the manifold challenges and issues related to web technologies and resource management of Digital Ecosystems. MEDES seeks related original research papers, industrial papers and proposals for demonstrations, tutorials and workshops.

MEDES 2025 will be held in **Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam**, from **November 24-26, 2025**.

## Topics

### DATA TRACK

*   Big data management
*   Smart Computing data management
*   Data integration, heterogeneous and federated databases
*   Data mining, knowledge discovery, information extraction
*   Data-centric AI
*   Data provenance, publishing, and citation
*   Data visualization
*   Data warehousing
*   Keyword-based and natural language access to structured data
*   Integration of large language models with databases and supporting services
*   Ontology-based data management
*   Data privacy, security, and trust management
*   Social networks and graph databases
*   Transaction and workflow management
*   Interoperability and web services
*   Responsible data management

### SOFTWARE TRACK

*   Digital Ecosystem Infrastructure
*   Digital Ecosystems self-properties management
*   Software engineering for Digital Ecosystems
*   Digital Ecosystems for software engineering
*   Computational and collective intelligence for Digital Ecosystems
*   Intelligent and self-adaptive Digital Ecosystems
*   Semantic computing techniques for Digital Ecosystems
*   IoT and intelligent web Digital Ecosystems
*   Digital twins Ecosystems
*   Digital Ecosystems across the computing continuum
*   Service design, specification, discovery, customization, composition, and deployment in Digital Ecosystems
*   Trust, Security & Privacy in Digital Ecosystems
*   Social and collaborative Digital Ecosystems
*   Human-Digital Ecosystems interaction and relationships
*   Maintenance and evolution of Digital Ecosystems
*   Green and sustainable Digital Ecosystems
*   Digital Ecosystems with emerging technologies (quantum, membrane, neuromorphic)
*   Digital Ecosystems in practice
*   Industrial Digital Ecosystems (logistics, energy, healthcare, environment, smart cities, robotics)

## Paper Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions must be in electronic form as **PDF format**.
*   The submitted paper should be at most **14 printed pages**. Papers that fail to comply with the length limit will be rejected.
*   Submissions will be peer-reviewed by at least 3 peer reviewers.
*   Selection criteria will include: relevance, significance, impact, originality, technical soundness, and quality of presentation.
*   Preference will be given to submissions that take strong or challenging positions on important emergent topics related to Digital Ecosystems.
*   At least one author should attend the conference to present the paper.

## Submission

All paper submissions for MEDES-2025 will be via **Easychair**: [https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=medes2025](https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=medes2025)

## Important Dates

### Main Conference:

*   **Regular paper submission deadline:** July 15, 2025
*   **Notification to authors:** August 15, 2025
*   **Camera-ready and copyright submission deadline:** September 16, 2025
*   **Authors registration deadline:** September 16, 2025

### Workshops:

*   **Workshop proposals due:** April 16, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** April 20, 2025

### Tutorials:

*   **Tutorial proposals due:** July 06, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 15, 2025

### PhD Forum and Posters:

*   **Paper proposals due:** July 06, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 31, 2025

## Publication

The conference Proceedings will be published and indexed by **Springer CCIS**.

### Special Issues:

Selected presented papers will be invited for submission to two Special Issues:

*   **WWW Journal** (Impact factor: 3.0 – Rank: Q1)
*   **SN Computer Science** (Impact factor: 3.78 – Rank: Q2)

## Policies

*   All contributions should be original and not published elsewhere or intended to be published during the review period.
*   Contributions from more applied related fields in industry and commerce are very welcome.
*   All accepted papers must be presented by one of the authors, who must register for the conference.
*   Authors are requested to avoid plagiarism and self-plagiarism.

## Participation Modes

MEDES will be an **in-person conference**.

callForPapers:
# MEMOCODE 2025: Call for Papers

MEMOCODE: ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Formal Methods and Models for System Design

Over the last decade, the boundaries between computer system components, such as hardware, software, firmware, middleware, and applications, have blurred. This evolution in system design and development practices led in 2014 to a change in the title and scope of the MEMOCODE conference from its original focus on hardware/software co-design to its new focus on formal methods and models for developing computer systems and their components. MEMOCODE’s objective is to emphasize the importance of models and methodologies in correct system design and development, and to bring together researchers and industry practitioners interested in all aspects of computer system development, to exchange ideas, research results and lessons learned.

ESWEEK 2025 will take place as an in-person event from **September 28th to October 3rd, 2025 in Taipei, Taiwan**. MEMOCODE is one of the symposia held as part of ESWEEK.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** April 28, 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission:** May 5, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 8, 2025
*   **Final Versions:** August 30, 2025
*   **Conference:** October 2-3, 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: MTNS 2026

The **University of Waterloo** is proud to host the **27th International Symposium on Mathematical Theory of Networks and Systems (MTNS) 2026**, taking place from **August 17-21, 2026**.

## About MTNS

MTNS is a major symposium in the general area of **mathematical systems theory, networks and control**. The symposium is **interdisciplinary** and attracts mathematicians, engineers and researchers working in all aspects of systems theory and its applications. Mathematical methods involved stem from various fields of pure and applied mathematics, including differential equations, analysis, numerical analysis, probability theory, operator theory, algebra, and geometry. Application areas range from biology, communications, and mathematical finance to engineering and robotics.

## Important Dates

*   **Proposals for mini-courses and invited sessions:** January 12, 2026*
*   **Invited session full papers and extended abstracts:** February 9, 2026*
*   **Contributed session full papers and extended abstracts:** February 9, 2026*
*   **Paper, invited session and mini-course decision notification:** May 11, 2026*
*   **Advance registration opens:** May 18, 2026*
*   **Final paper upload due:** TBC
*   **Early bird registration closes:** TBC

*Tentative dates.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Format:** All manuscripts should be prepared and submitted according to **IFAC requirements**.
*   **Paper Length:** Submitted regular papers will have an extension between **4 (minimum) and 6 pages (maximum)**. Illustrations, tables, and references are included in the page count.
*   **Language:** All contributions must be in **English**.
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers will be published in the **IFAC Papers-Online series** hosted on ScienceDirect.
*   **Copyright Conditions:** Authors must grant exclusive publishing rights to IFAC under a **Creative Commons license** when submitting the final version. Authors retain copyright and all intellectual property rights.

## Submission Types

*   Regular papers
*   Proposals for mini-courses
*   Proposals for invited sessions (full papers and extended abstracts)
*   Contributed session full papers and extended abstracts
*   Extended abstracts

## Registration Fees

Information regarding registration fees is not detailed in the provided text.

## Contact Information

For detailed information regarding submissions and author guidelines, please refer to the [Author Information](https://uwaterloo.ca/international-symposium-mathematical-theory-networks-systems/author-information) section of the conference website.

callForPapers:
# MEDI 2024: Call for Papers

The Thirteenth International Conference on Model & Data Engineering (MEDI 2024), ranked C By CORE 2021, will be held from **November 18 - 20, 2024** in **Naples, Italy**.

MEDI provides an international platform for the presentation of research on models and data theory, the development of advanced technologies related to models and data, and their advanced applications.

## Submission Types

*   **Full Research Papers**
*   **Short Research Papers**

## Important Dates

*   **Full-paper submission:** September 20, 2024
*   **Acceptance notification:** October 17, 2024 (U.S. time)
*   **Registration deadline:** October 20, 2024
*   **Camera Ready submission:** October 30, 2024

## Topics of Interest

*   Models and data theory
*   Development of advanced technologies related to models and data
*   Advanced applications of models and data

## Publication

*   MEDI 2024 proceedings are published by IARIA Press and archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library.
*   Prints are available at Curran Associates, Inc.
*   Authors of best papers will be invited for submission in special issues of Elsevier Journal of Computer Languages (COLA).

## Submission Guidelines

Detailed submission guidelines can be found [here](/index.php/submission-guidelines).

## Review Process

The review process details are available on the conference website.

## Contact

For questions concerning MEDI 2024, contact MEDI Support at [medi@unina.it](mailto:medi@unina.it).

summary: The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP) 2025 will be held in Singapore from Sunday, October 12 to Saturday, October 18, 2025. For the first time, ICFP will be co-located with SPLASH, forming the joint ICFP/SPLASH 2025 conference, offering a comprehensive forum for research and development in functional programming.
callForPapers:
# ICFP 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP) 2025 invites submissions on the design, implementations, principles, and uses of functional programming. This year, ICFP is co-located with SPLASH as part of the joint **ICFP/SPLASH 2025 conference**, taking place in **Singapore** from **October 12 to October 18, 2025**.

PACMPL (ICFP) seeks original papers on the art and science of functional programming, covering the entire spectrum of work from practice to theory.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):

*   **Language Design:** concurrency, parallelism, distribution, modularity, components, meta-programming, macros, pattern matching, type systems (type inference, dependent types, effect types, gradual types, refinement types, session types), interoperability, domain-specific languages, imperative programming, object-oriented programming, logic programming, probabilistic programming, reactive programming, generic programming, bidirectional programming.
*   **Implementation:** abstract machines, virtual machines, interpretation, compilation, optimization, garbage collection, runtime systems, multi-threading, parallel hardware exploitation, foreign function interfaces.
*   **Software-Development Techniques:** algorithms, data structures, design patterns, specification, verification, validation, proof assistants, debugging, testing, tracing, profiling, build systems, program synthesis.
*   **Foundations:** formal semantics, lambda calculus, program equivalence, rewriting, type theory, logic, category theory, computational effects, continuations, control, state, names, binding, program verification.
*   **Analysis and Transformation:** control flow, data flow, abstract interpretation, partial evaluation, program calculation.
*   **Applications:** symbolic computing, formal-methods tools, artificial intelligence, systems programming, distributed systems, web programming, hardware design, databases, scientific and numerical computing, graphical user interfaces, graphics, multimedia, GPU programming, scripting, system administration, security.
*   **Education:** teaching introductory programming, mathematical proof, algebra.

## Submission Types

In addition to research papers, ICFP 2025 also welcomes:

*   **Functional Pearls:** Elegant essays on functional programming, which may include new perspectives on old ideas, instructive examples, nifty data structures, interesting applications, or classroom uses. These are valued and judged rigorously, focusing on conciseness, instructiveness, and entertainment.
*   **Experience Reports:** Descriptions of practical experiences using functional programming in industry, tool development, or education. These papers need not report original research but should illuminate aspects of functional programming use, providing evidence for a clear thesis.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Review Process:** ICFP 2025 will employ a **full double-blind reviewing process**. Authors must omit their names and institutions from submissions, and refer to their own work in the third person.
*   **Formatting:** Submissions must be in **PDF format**, printable in black and white on US Letter paper, and adhere to the **“ACM Small” template** (available in LaTeX and Word).
    *   Full papers and Functional Pearls: up to **25 pages** (bibliography and optional appendix excluded).
    *   Experience Reports: up to **12 pages** (bibliography excluded).
*   **Submission System:** Submissions are accepted via href="https://icfp25.hotcrp.com/" - https://icfp25.hotcrp.com/ .
*   **Supplementary Material:** Authors may include a clearly marked appendix and/or attach supplementary material. All supplementary material must be anonymized and uploaded at submission time; URLs pointing to external repositories are not permitted.
*   **ORCID:** ACM requires an ORCID iD for every author. Please ensure you have all coauthors' ORCID iDs before submitting.
*   **Republication Policy:** Submissions must adhere to SIGPLAN’s republication policy.

## Important Dates (AoE - Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Submission Deadline:** Thursday, **27 February 2025**
*   **Author Response Period:** Monday, 28 April 2025 - Thursday, 1 May 2025
*   **Notification of Conditional Acceptance:** Friday, 23 May 2025
*   **Deadline for Submitting Revisions:** Thursday, 12 June 2025
*   **Final Decision Notification:** Friday, 27 June 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** Friday, 11 July 2025

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors of conditionally accepted papers are encouraged to submit supporting materials for Artifact Evaluation. Successfully evaluated artifacts will receive a seal of approval.

## Contact

Please contact the Program Chair if you have questions or concerns about the appropriateness of a topic.

callForPapers:
# SERA 2025: Call for Papers

The 23rd IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering, Management and Applications (SERA 2025) brings together researchers, scientists, engineers, industry practitioners, and students to discuss, encourage, and exchange new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of Software Engineering, Management, and Applications.

The conference will take place from **May 29-31, 2025**, at the **UNLV Campus in Las Vegas, USA**.

## Topics of Interest

SERA 2025 aims to facilitate cross-fertilizations among, and is soliciting papers in the key technology enabling areas, encompassing **all aspects of Software Engineering, Management, and Applications**.

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop/Special Session Proposal:** January 10, 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission:** March 28, 2025 (extended)
*   **Acceptance Notification (papers submitted by March 14):** April 11, 2025 (postponed)
*   **Acceptance Notification (papers submitted after March 14):** April 11, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Papers/Registration:** April 18, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit their full papers following the provided instructions. All accepted papers must have at least one author registered by the camera-ready deadline to be included in the proceedings.

*   **Paper Submission Instructions:** [https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-paper-submission-for-review-2/](https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-paper-submission-for-review-2/)
*   **Final Paper Submissions:** [https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-final-paper-submission-instructions-2](https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-final-paper-submission-instructions-2)

## Special Sessions and Workshops

*   **Special Session/Workshop Proposal Deadline:** January 10, 2025
*   **Special Sessions Information:** [https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-special-sessions](https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-special-sessions)
*   **Special Session/Workshop Proposal Form:** [http://acisinternational.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WorkshopSpecialSessionProposal1-25.pdf](http://acisinternational.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/WorkshopSpecialSessionProposal1-25.pdf)

## Registration Fees

For detailed registration and payment information, please visit the official registration link and consult the fee schedule.

*   **Registration Link:** [https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-registration/](https://acisinternational.org/sera-2025-registration/)
*   **Fee Schedule PDF:** [http://acisinternational.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/SERA2025FeeSchedule.pdf](http://acisinternational.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/SERA2025FeeSchedule.pdf)

### Registration Categories and Fees:

*   **Regular Registration (In-Person):**
    *   By **April 18, 2025**: **$750**
    *   After **April 18, 2025**: **$800**
*   **Student Registration (In-Person):**
    *   By **April 18, 2025**: **$400**
    *   After **April 18, 2025**: **$450**
*   **Online Registration (Virtual Participation):**
    *   **Regular:** **$450**
    *   **Student:** **$300**

### Additional Fees:

*   **Extra Page Charge:** **$100** per page (up to 2 extra pages allowed)
*   **Extra Paper Charge:** **$400** (for one additional paper if presenting multiple)

### What Registration Includes:

*   **In-person registration includes:** Conference Proceedings (USB or digital download), reception, coffee breaks, and lunches for three days, plus a banquet.
*   **Online registration includes:** Digital proceedings only.
*   **IEEE/ACIS Membership:** 1-year membership is included with registration.

> **Refund Policy:** Registration fees are **non-refundable after April 18, 2025**. Cancellations prior to **April 18, 2025**, are subject to a **$100** processing fee.

## Keynote Speaker

*   **Prof. Lawrence Chung** (The University of Texas at Dallas, USA)

## Publication

Conference proceedings will be published by **IEEE** and **ACIS**, and will be available as a USB or digital download for in-person attendees, and digitally for online attendees.

## Contact Information

For general inquiries, please contact:

*   **Email:** `acis@acisinternational.org`

**ACIS Offices:**

*   **Michigan Office:** 619 S Mission St, Mt. Pleasant, MI 48858, U.S.A.
*   **Florida Office:** 4088 Basket Oak Cir., Vero Beach, FL 32967, U.S.A.
